posts.post_content:
He reminds me a bit of a black interpretation of [Tradewind Rider](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tradewind Rider).  
  
Sure, having two further creatures available to tap in a turn a forth one died is a *really* tough requirement.  
But man, this guy is a splashable 1/2 two-drop that can create flying 5/5s. That *is* pretty freaking awesome.  
  
Just play him with the right cards.  
There are many cards that can create you multiple tokens for little mana, especially in white:  
[Raise the Alarm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Raise the Alarm), [Spectral Procession](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spectral Procession), [Timely Reinforcements](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Timely Reinforcements), [Master's Call](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master's Call), [Midnight Haunting](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Midnight Haunting), or [Waylay](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Waylay) for example.   
  
And getting the morbid trigger also isn't too hard with a sac outlet -  
or any creature that can sac itself for something good.  
Eldrazi spawns do a great job since they are tokens with an inherent saccing option for mana accel.  
[Emrakul's Hatcher](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emrakul's Hatcher), [Dread Drone/auto](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dread Drone/auto)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

Just play him with the right cards.
There are many cards that can create you multiple tokens for little mana, especially in white:
Raise the Alarm, Spectral Procession, Timely Reinforcements, Master's Call, Midnight Haunting, or Waylay for example.

And getting the morbid trigger also isn't too hard with a sac outlet -

posts.post_content:
This + [Reassembling Skeleton](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reassembling Skeleton) + [Carrion Feeder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Carrion Feeder). Sac the skeleton, recast it, tap all three for 5/5 flying demon. Wash, rinse, repeat next turn.  
  
@ Hall,  
1) Yes, since it's a normal activated ability and the text doesn't list any restrictions ( like "Play this only when you could play a sorcery,") it can be used at instant speed.  
  
2) In that instance, no that doesn't appear legal. Tapping the two creatures is part of the ability cost, not the effect, and has to be paid before the ability can even be put on the stack. If you have multiple priests, their abilities still have to resolve one at a time. If you go to activate one and then respond to that by using the other priest to tap the first, that will cause the first priest to tap before his ability can even be triggered.  
  
That being said, only the priest has to be able to tap on his own. You can tap creatures with summoning sickness as part of his cost. With that in mind, if you have mult... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
This + Reassembling Skeleton + Carrion Feeder. Sac the skeleton, recast it, tap all three for 5/5 flying demon. Wash, rinse, repeat next turn.

@ Hall,
1) Yes, since it's a normal activated ability and the text doesn't list any restrictions ( like "Play this only when you could play a sorcery,") it can be used at instant speed.

2) In that instance, no that doesn't appear legal. Tapping the two creatures is part of the ability cost, not the effect, and has to be paid before the ability can even be put on the stack. If you have multiple priests, their abilities still have to resolve one at a time. If you go to activate one and then respond to that by using the other priest to tap the first, that will cause the first priest to tap before his ability can even be triggered.

That being said, only the priest has to be able to tap on his own. You can tap creatures with summoning sickness as part of his cost. With that in mind, if you have mult... (see all)

posts.post_content:
I've got a few questions regarding the priest. Can his activated ability be used during an opponents turn as in after combat when a creature has died.   
  
The next question comes from a game I played online and I'm just confirming this for the future. I had an opponent use a [Mimic Vat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mimic Vat) to clone my priest on my end step. He then brought in another at the beginning of his turn. He had two priests and a myr at that point. He killed one of my creatures with a spell and activated the priests abilities to spin two demons. I've been working under the assumption that if I had two priests that I would have to have have four untapped creatures + the priests + morbid to spin out two demons. Can the priests count each other as untapped creatures and tap for the ability, also can each priest use the myr as the second creature? I might have missed some tokens or something and that was my first ever online game, but that was what I thought I saw happen.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Why hasn't anyone mentioned [Awakening Zone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Awakening Zone) yet?  
Drop a forest and [Joraga Treespeaker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Joraga Treespeaker) turn one, then next turn, level her up, on turn three, another land, then [Awakening Zone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Awakening Zone). Now, every turn you will be able to get a 5/5. Add in [parallel lives](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=parallel lives), and [Seedborn Muse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seedborn Muse) Also, since we are tapping everything for nuts-crazy, one or two [Verdant Force](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Verdant Force)s, and enjoy your army of fliers.

posts.post_content: This guy enables the black weenie deck like nothing else. Carrion Feeder is a good sac outlet also add him a marrow gnawer/ rat deck and your opponent is backed into a corner. The Marrow-Gnawer synergy is actually quite frightening as well as resisting both blockers with fear and some removal because it's black (Snuff Out etc are useless.). Provided you have got the right mana accel (Lake of the dead, Cabal Coffers, Culling The Week) he's sure to be a valuable combo piece.
posts.html:
